channel.title: haskell on Ross A. Baker
channel.description: Recent content in haskell on Ross A. Baker

item.description: The concept of "monadic profunctors"¹ for codecs is beautiful: ``` data Codec r w c a = Codec { codecIn :: r a, codecOut :: c → w a } ``` A parser `r a` may have expensive optimizations in its functor ops (run once) and then fast on each parse. Printer `w a` may be the same, but depends on input `c`, and must be recreated on each run.

Sometimes, Haskell documentation disappoints. Other times: > Mnemonic: Clowns to the left (parameter of the Bifunctor), jokers to the right. https://hackage.haskell.org/package/bifunctors-5.5.7/docs/Data-Bifunctor-Clown.html #Haskell

item.title: The Scala Logs
item.description: It was my honor to join Zach McCoy on the first full episode of The Scala Logs, where we talked http4s, Haskell, and hockey.
